market-oriented.translation[0].definitio: a market-oriented economy, society, system etc is one with FREE MARKETs where people can buy and sell freely and where most companies are not owned by the state
He plans to replace the rigid planned economy with a more market-oriented one.
market-oriented activities are designed to lead to a more market-oriented economy
Hungary and Poland were ahead of their neighbors in adopting market-oriented policies.
a company that is market-oriented tries to design and sell products that satisfy customers’ needs
